original: Majjhima Nikāya 69
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Goliyānisutta
analyzed: goliyānisutta
translated: With Goliyāni

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

original: Tena kho pana samayena goliyāni nāma bhikkhu āraññiko padasamācāro saṅghamajjhe osaṭo hoti kenacideva karaṇīyena.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena goliyāni nāma bhikkhu āraññikaḥ pada samācāraḥ saṅgha majjhe osaṭaḥ hoti kenacid eva karaṇīyena
translated: Now at that time a monk named Goliyāni, who lived in the wilderness, observed the practice of walking back and forth in the midst of the Sangha, but for some reason he was despised by the Sangha.

original: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto goliyāniṁ bhikkhuṁ ārabbha bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: tatra kho āyasmā sāriputtaḥ goliyānim bhikkhum ārabbha bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Then Venerable Sāriputta addressed the monks about the monk Goliyāni:

original: “Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena sabrahmacārīsu sagāravena bhavitabbaṁ sappatissena.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena sabrahmacārīsu sa gāravena bhavitabbam sa patissena
translated: “A wilderness monk, friends, who has come to the Sangha and is living in the Sangha should be respectful and deferential toward his companions in the holy life.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu saṅghagato saṅghe viharanto sabrahmacārīsu agāravo hoti appatisso, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu saṅgha gataḥ saṅghe viharantaḥ sabrahmacārīsu agāravaḥ hoti appatissaḥ tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If a wilderness monk who has come to the Sangha and is living in the Sangha is disrespectful and undeferential toward his companions in the holy life,🔽there will be those who say of him:

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena, yo ayamāyasmā sabrahmacārīsu agāravo hoti appatisso’ti—
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa araññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā sabrahmacārīsu agāravaḥ hoti appatissaḥ ti
translated: ‘What is this venerable wilderness-dweller’s one-man wilderness-dwelling for, if he is disrespectful and undeferential toward his companions in the holy life?’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: There will be those who say this.

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena sabrahmacārīsu sagāravena bhavitabbaṁ sappatissena.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena sabrahmacārīsu sa gāravena bhavitabbam sa patissena
translated: Therefore, a wilderness-dwelling monk who has gone to the Saṅgha and is living in the Saṅgha should be respectful and deferential toward his companions in the holy life.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena āsanakusalena bhavitabbaṁ:
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena āsana kusalena bhavitabba
translated: “A wilderness-dwelling monk who has gone to the Saṅgha and is living in the Saṅgha should be skilled in the seats,

original: ‘iti there ca bhikkhū nānupakhajja nisīdissāmi nave ca bhikkhū na āsanena paṭibāhissāmī’ti.
analyzed: iti there ca bhikkhū na an upakhajja nisīdissāmi nave ca bhikkhū na āsanena paṭibāhissāmi iti
translated: thinking, ‘I won’t sit down encroaching on the senior monks, and I won’t block the junior monks from getting a seat.’

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu saṅghagato saṅghe viharanto na āsanakusalo hoti, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu saṅgha gataḥ saṅghe viharantaḥ na āsana kusalaḥ hoti tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: “If a wilderness-dwelling monk who has gone to the Saṅgha and is living in the Saṅgha is not skilled in the seats, there will be those who say,

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena, yo ayamāyasmā āsanakusalo na hotī’ti—
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa araññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmai āsana kusalaḥ na hoti iti
translated: ‘What is this wilderness-dwelling monk’s one wilderness quality for, when he is not skilled in the seats?’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.🔽Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena āsanakusalena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ  tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena āsana kusalena bhavitabba
translated: There will be those who say this.🔽Therefore, a wilderness-dwelling monk who has gone to the Saṅgha and is living in the Saṅgha should be skilled in the seats.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena ābhisamācārikopi dhammo jānitabbo.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena ābhisamācārikaḥ api dhammaḥ jānitabbo
translated: “A wilderness-dwelling monk who has gone to the Saṅgha and is living in the Saṅgha should know the basic rules of training.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu saṅghagato saṅghe viharanto ābhisamācārikampi dhammaṁ na jānāti, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu saṅgha gataḥ saṅghe viharantaḥ ābhisamācārikam pi dhammam na jānāti tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If a wilderness-dwelling monk, when dwelling in the Sangha, doesn’t know the basic rules, people will complain,

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā ābhisamācārikampi dhammaṁ na jānātī’ti—
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa araññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmai ābhisamācārikam pi dhammam na jānāti iti
translated: saying, ‘Why should this wilderness-dwelling monk, who lives alone in the wilderness, not know the basic rules?’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: People will complain,

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena ābhisamācārikopi dhammo jānitabbo.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena ābhisamācārikaḥ api dhammaḥ jānitabbaḥ
translated: That’s why a wilderness-dwelling monk, when dwelling in the Sangha, should know the basic rules.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena nātikālena gāmo pavisitabbo nātidivā paṭikkamitabbaṁ.🔽Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu saṅghagato saṅghe viharanto atikālena gāmaṁ pavisati atidivā paṭikkamati, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena na atikālena gāmaḥ pavisitabbaḥ na atidivā paṭikkamitabba 🔽sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu saṅgha gataḥ saṅghe viharantaḥ atikālena gāmam pavisati atidivā paṭikkamati tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: A wilderness-dwelling monk, when dwelling in the Sangha, shouldn’t enter the village too early or return too late in the day.🔽If he does, people will complain,

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā atikālena gāmaṁ pavisati atidivā paṭikkamatī’ti—
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa araññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā ati kālena gāmam pavisati atidivā paṭikkamati iti
translated: ‘But what’s the point of this wilderness-dweller’s living alone in the wilderness if he enters the village at the wrong time and returns at the wrong time?’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.🔽Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena nātikālena gāmo pavisitabbo, nātidivā paṭikkamitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ  tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena na ati kālena gāmaḥ pavisitabbaḥ na ati divā paṭikkamitabba
translated: They would be his critics.🔽So a wilderness-dwelling monk who has joined the Sangha and is living in the Sangha shouldn’t enter the village at the wrong time or return at the wrong time.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena na purebhattaṁ pacchābhattaṁ kulesu cārittaṁ āpajjitabbaṁ.🔽Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu saṅghagato saṅghe viharanto purebhattaṁ pacchābhattaṁ kulesu cārittaṁ āpajjati, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena na purebhattam pacchābhattam kulesu cārittam āpajjitabba  sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu saṅgha gataḥ saṅghe viharantaḥ purebhattam pacchābhattam kulesu cārittam āpajjati tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: A wilderness-dwelling monk who has joined the Sangha and is living in the Sangha shouldn’t visit families before or after a meal.🔽If he does, he’ll be criticized.

original: ‘Ayaṁ nūnimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena viharato vikālacariyā bahulīkatā, tamenaṁ saṅghagatampi samudācaratī’ti—
analyzed: ayam nūnimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa āraññe serivihārena viharataḥ vikāla cariyā bahulīkatā tam enam saṅgha gatam pi samudācarati iti
translated: ‘This wilderness-dwelling monk is obviously used to wandering alone in the wilderness. That’s why he’s doing this even though he’s in the Sangha.’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: They would be his critics.

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena na purebhattaṁ pacchābhattaṁ kulesu cārittaṁ āpajjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena na purebhattam pacchābhattam kulesu cārittam
translated: So a wilderness-dwelling monk who has gone to the Saṅgha and is living in the Saṅgha shouldn’t go on rounds of families before or after the meal.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena anuddhatena bhavitabbaṁ acapalena.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena an uddhatena bhavitabbam a capalena
translated: “A wilderness-dwelling monk who has gone to the Saṅgha and is living in the Saṅgha shouldn’t be restless and puffed up.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu saṅghagato saṅghe viharanto uddhato hoti capalo, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu saṅgha gataḥ saṅghe viharantaḥ uddhataḥ hoti capalaḥ tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If a wilderness-dwelling monk who has gone to the Saṅgha and is living in the Saṅgha is restless and puffed up, there are grounds for censure.

original: ‘Idaṁ nūnimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena viharato uddhaccaṁ cāpalyaṁ bahulīkataṁ, tamenaṁ saṅghagatampi samudācaratī’ti—
analyzed: idam nūnam assa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa āraññe sa iri vihārena viharataḥ uddhaccam cāpalyam tam enam saṅgha gatam pi samudācarati iti
translated: ‘This restlessness and puffiness of his is due to his living alone in the wilderness.’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.🔽Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena anuddhatena bhavitabbaṁ acapalena.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ  tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena an uddhatena bhavitabbam a capalena
translated: There are grounds for censure.🔽So a wilderness-dwelling monk who has gone to the Saṅgha and is living in the Saṅgha shouldn’t be restless and puffed up.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena amukharena bhavitabbaṁ avikiṇṇavācena.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena a mukharena bhavitabbam a vikiṇṇa vācena
translated: “A wilderness-dwelling monk who has gone to the Saṅgha and is living in the Saṅgha shouldn’t be loud and noisy.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu saṅghagato saṅghe viharanto mukharo hoti vikiṇṇavāco, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu saṅgha gataḥ saṅghe viharantaḥ mukharaḥ hoti vikiṇṇa vācaḥ tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If a wilderness-dwelling monk is talkative and rambling in the midst of the Sangha, people will complain and say,

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā mukharo vikiṇṇavāco’ti—
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa āraññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā mukharaḥ vikiṇṇa vācaḥ ti
translated: ‘What’s the point of this venerable wilderness-dweller living alone in the wilderness if he’s talkative and rambling?’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: People will complain about him.

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena amukharena bhavitabbaṁ avikiṇṇavācena.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena a mukharena bhavitabbam a vikiṇṇa vācena
translated: So a wilderness-dwelling monk should not be talkative and rambling in the midst of the Sangha.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena suvacena bhavitabbaṁ kalyāṇamittena.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena suvacena bhavitabbam kalyāṇa mittena
translated: He should be easy to talk to and have good friends.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu saṅghagato saṅghe viharanto dubbaco hoti pāpamitto, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu saṅgha gataḥ saṅghe viharantaḥ dubbacaḥ hoti pāpa mitto tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If a wilderness-dwelling monk is difficult to talk to and has bad friends in the midst of the Sangha, people will complain and say,

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā dubbaco pāpamitto’ti—
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa āraññe sa iri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā dubbacaḥ pāpa mittaḥ ti
translated: ‘What’s the point of this venerable wilderness-dweller living alone in the wilderness if he’s difficult to talk to and has bad friends?’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: People will complain about him.

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅghagatena saṅghe viharantena suvacena bhavitabbaṁ kalyāṇamittena.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā saṅgha gatena saṅghe viharantena suvacena bhavitabbam kalyāṇa mittena
translated: So a wilderness-dwelling monk who has gone to the Saṅgha or is living with the Saṅgha should be easy to correct and have good friends.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā indriyesu guttadvārena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā indriyesu gutta dvārena
translated: “A wilderness-dwelling monk should guard the doors to his sense faculties.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu indriyesu aguttadvāro hoti, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu indriyesu a gutta dvāraḥ hoti tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If a wilderness-dwelling monk doesn’t guard the doors to his sense faculties, there will be those who say,

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā indriyesu aguttadvāro’ti—
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa āraññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā indriyesu a gutta dvārā ti
translated: ‘What is this wilderness-dwelling monk’s wilderness-dwelling for, going alone in the wilderness and guarding the doors to his sense faculties?’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: There will be those who say this.

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā indriyesu guttadvārena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā indriyesu gutta dvārena
translated: So a wilderness-dwelling monk should guard the doors to his sense faculties.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā bhojane mattaññunā bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā bhojane mattaññunā
translated: “A wilderness-dwelling monk should know the right amount in eating.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu bhojane amattaññū hoti, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu bhojane a mattaññū hoti tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If a wilderness-dwelling monk doesn’t know the right amount in eating, there will be those who say,

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā bhojane amattaññū’ti—
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa āraññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā bhojane amattaññu iti
translated: ‘What is this wilderness-dwelling monk’s wilderness-dwelling for, going alone in the wilderness and not knowing the right amount in eating?’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: There will be those who say this.

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā bhojane mattaññunā bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā bhojane mattaññunā
translated: So a wilderness-dwelling monk should know moderation in eating.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā jāgariyaṁ anuyuttena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā jāgariyam anuyuttena
translated: ‘Friends, a wilderness-dwelling monk should be devoted to wakefulness.🔽If a wilderness-dwelling monk is not devoted to wakefulness,

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu jāgariyaṁ ananuyutto hoti, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu jāgariyam an anuyuttaḥ hoti tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: there will be those who say of him:

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā jāgariyaṁ ananuyutto’ti—🔽tassa bhavanti vattāro.🔽Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā jāgariyaṁ anuyuttena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa āraññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā jāgariyam an anuyuttaḥ ti  tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ  tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā jāgariyam anuyuttena bhavitabba
translated: ‘What is this venerable wilderness-dweller’s seclusion for, if he is not devoted to wakefulness?’🔽So a wilderness-dwelling monk should be devoted to wakefulness.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā āraddhavīriyena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā āraddha vīriyena
translated: ‘Friends, a wilderness-dwelling monk should be energetic.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu kusīto hoti, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu kusītaḥ hoti tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If a wilderness-dwelling monk is lazy, there will be those who say of him:

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā kusīto’ti—🔽tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa araññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā kusītaḥ ti  tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: ‘What is this venerable wilderness-dweller’s seclusion for, if he is lazy?’

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā āraddhavīriyena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā āraddha vīriyena
translated: So a wilderness-dwelling monk should be energetic.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā upaṭṭhitassatinā bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā upaṭṭhita ssatinā
translated: A wilderness-dwelling monk should be one who has established mindfulness.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu muṭṭhassatī hoti, tassa bhavanti vattāro.🔽‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā muṭṭhassatī’ti—
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu muṭṭha ssatī hoti tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ  kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa āraññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā muṭṭhassati iti
translated: If a wilderness-dwelling monk is muddle-minded,

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: there will be those who say,🔽‘What is this wilderness-dwelling monk doing alone in the wilderness? He is muddle-minded.’

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā upaṭṭhitassatinā bhavitabbaṁ.🔽Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā samāhitena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā upaṭṭhita ssatinā  āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā samāhitena
translated: That is why a wilderness-dwelling monk should be one who has established mindfulness.🔽A wilderness-dwelling monk should be one who is concentrated.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu asamāhito hoti, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu asamāhitaḥ hoti tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If a wilderness-dwelling monk is not concentrated,🔽there will be those who say,

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā asamāhito’ti—🔽tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa āraññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā asamāhitaḥ ti  tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: ‘What is this wilderness-dwelling monk doing alone in the wilderness? He is not concentrated.’

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā samāhitena bhavitabbaṁ.🔽Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā paññavatā bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā samāhitena  āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā paññavatā
translated: That is why a wilderness-dwelling monk should be one who is concentrated.🔽A wilderness-dwelling monk should be wise.🔽If a wilderness-dwelling monk is ignorant,

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu duppañño hoti, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu duppaññaḥ hoti tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: there will be those who say,

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā duppañño’ti—
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa araññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā duppaññaḥ ti
translated: ‘What’s the point of this wilderness-dweller’s dwelling alone in the wilderness if he’s not even wise?’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.🔽Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā paññavatā bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ  tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā paññavatā
translated: They would criticize him.🔽So a wilderness-dwelling monk should be wise.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā abhidhamme abhivinaye yogo karaṇīyo.🔽Santāvuso, āraññikaṁ bhikkhuṁ abhidhamme abhivinaye pañhaṁ pucchitāro.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā abhidhamme abhivinaye yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ  santi āvuso āraññikam bhikkhum abhidhamme abhivinaye pañham pucchitāraḥ
translated: ‘A wilderness-dwelling monk should apply himself to the higher Dhamma and the higher Vinaya.🔽There are those who ask a wilderness-dwelling monk about the higher Dhamma and the higher Vinaya.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu abhidhamme abhivinaye pañhaṁ puṭṭho na sampāyati, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu abhidhamme abhivinaye pañham puṭṭhaḥ na sampāyati tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If he doesn’t answer properly, they would criticize him,

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā abhidhamme abhivinaye pañhaṁ puṭṭho na sampāyatī’ti—
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa āraññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmai abhidhamme abhivinaye pañham puṭṭhaḥ na sampāyati iti
translated: saying, ‘What’s the point of this wilderness-dweller’s dwelling alone in the wilderness if he doesn’t even answer properly when asked about the higher Dhamma and the higher Vinaya?’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: They would criticize him.

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā abhidhamme abhivinaye yogo karaṇīyo.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā abhidhamme abhivinaye yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: So a wilderness-dwelling monk should apply himself to the higher Dhamma and the higher Vinaya.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā tattha yogo karaṇīyo.🔽Santāvuso, āraññikaṁ bhikkhuṁ ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā tattha pañhaṁ pucchitāro.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā tattha yogaḥ karaṇīyo  santi āvuso āraññikam bhikkhum ye te santā vimokkhāḥ atikkamma rūpe āruppā tattha pañham pucchitāro
translated: A wilderness-dwelling monk should practice for the attainment of those liberations that are peaceful and immaterial, transcending form.🔽There are those who ask wilderness-dwelling monks about those liberations that are peaceful and immaterial, transcending form.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā tattha pañhaṁ puṭṭho na sampāyati, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu ye te santā vimokkhāḥ atikkamma rūpe āruppā tattha pañham puṭṭhaḥ na sampāyati tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If a wilderness-dwelling monk doesn’t answer their questions, he gets criticized:

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā tattha pañhaṁ puṭṭho na sampāyatī’ti—
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa āraññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā tattha pañham puṭṭhaḥ na sampāyati iti
translated: ‘What’s the point of this venerable’s wilderness dwelling, living on the outskirts, if he doesn’t answer questions?’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: He gets criticized.

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā tattha yogo karaṇīyo.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā tattha yogaḥ karaṇīyo
translated: That’s why a wilderness-dwelling monk should practice for the attainment of those liberations that are peaceful and immaterial, transcending form.

original: Āraññikenāvuso, bhikkhunā uttari manussadhamme yogo karaṇīyo.
analyzed: āraññikena āvuso bhikkhunā uttari manussa dhamme yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: A wilderness-dwelling monk should practice for the attainment of superhuman abilities.

original: Santāvuso, āraññikaṁ bhikkhuṁ uttari manussadhamme pañhaṁ pucchitāro.
analyzed: santi āvuso āraññikam bhikkhum uttari manussa dhamme pañham pucchitāraḥ
translated: There are people who ask the wilderness-dwelling monk questions about higher states.

original: Sace, āvuso, āraññiko bhikkhu uttari manussadhamme pañhaṁ puṭṭho na sampāyati, tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: sace āvuso āraññikaḥ bhikkhu uttari manussa dhamme pañham puṭṭhaḥ na sampāyati tassa bhavanti vattāro
translated: If he doesn’t answer properly, he gets criticized:

original: ‘Kiṁ panimassāyasmato āraññikassa ekassāraññe serivihārena yo ayamāyasmā yassatthāya pabbajito tamatthaṁ na jānātī’ti—
analyzed: kim panimassa āyasmataḥ āraññikassa ekassa āraññe seri vihārena yaḥ ayam āyasmā yad atthāya pabbajitaḥ tam attham na jānāti iti
translated: ‘What’s the point of this person’s wilderness dwelling, living off the wilderness, if he doesn’t even know the purpose for which he went forth?’

original: tassa bhavanti vattāro.
analyzed: tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ
translated: He gets criticized.

original: Tasmā āraññikena bhikkhunā uttari manussadhamme yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
analyzed: tasmai āraññikena bhikkhunā uttari manussa dhamme yogo karaṇīyaḥ ti
translated: That’s why a wilderness-dwelling monk should practice to attain the higher states.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā mahāmoggallāno āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ āyasmantam sāriputtam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna said to Venerable Sāriputta,

original: “āraññikeneva nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, bhikkhunā ime dhammā samādāya vattitabbā udāhu gāmantavihārināpī”ti?
analyzed: āraññikena iva nu kho āvuso sāriputta bhikkhunā ime dhammā samādāya vattitabbā udāhu gāmantavihārinā api iti
translated: “Friend Sāriputta, should these things be undertaken and practiced only by a wilderness-dwelling monk, or by a village-dwelling monk as well?”

original: “Āraññikenāpi kho, āvuso moggallāna, bhikkhunā ime dhammā samādāya vattitabbā pageva gāmantavihārinā”ti.
analyzed: āraññikena api kho āvuso moggallāna bhikkhunā ime dhammā samādāya vattitabbā pagā iva gāmanta vihārinā ati
translated: “Friend Moggallāna, these things should be undertaken and practiced by a village-dwelling monk, let alone a wilderness-dwelling monk.”

original: Goliyānisuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: goliyāni suttam niṭṭhitam navama
translated: The ninth section for recitation on the wilderness-dweller is finished.
